p: Commonly known as sandalwoods, this family includes more than 1000 species grouped into around 40 genera distributed worldwide. Half of the genera are found in dry or temperate areas, while the other half are found in tropical rainforests. The group includes perennial herbs, epiphytic climbers, shrubs, and small trees. Most species are hemiparasitic towards other plants (e.g., Mistletoe; aerial parasitism).
